text: Can someone please help me to use indexedDB in cms-js-building-block-
Hey, is it possible to set different values to a module setting for the mobile breakpoint in self-written modules? Like you can with the default modules and areas etc. of HubSpot?

This is a fairly broad request, but in general I would say that any interaction with client side storage solution be it localStorage, indexedDB etc - would have to happen in an island, and only on the client - so like after the hydration step.
This not something that is currently available

Hello Again, Im using the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/tree/main/hello-world> to build a project. I was able to create partials, but when I want to use the theme I donâ€™t see it available. Is there something I need to add to be able to see this in the pages or in website/themes in the settings?

You can use them in places that support HubL (like coded templates). See here for docs: <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-js-building-block-examples/reference/js-partials.html>

```{% js_partial
   path="@projects/project-folder/js-package/components/partials/Header.jsx"
   pageTitle="My page"
%}```
if you want to use drag and drop you can use modules. Either JS modules or as a JS Partial inside of a regular HubSpot module
Thanks <@UAYBXDG4U> Your response is beneficial to me.
